[Bootstrap's grid layout system](https://quarto.org/docs/output-formats/page-layout.html#css-grid) provides true flexibility. It can get quite complicated.

::: {.grid .column-screen}

::: {.g-col-12 .g-col-md-4}
```{python}
# | echo: false
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Parameters for the normal distribution
mean = 0
std_dev = 1
x = np.linspace(mean - 4*std_dev, mean + 4*std_dev, 1000)
y_light = (1/(std_dev * np.sqrt(2 * np.pi))) * \
    np.exp(-0.5 * ((x - mean) / std_dev)**2)
y_dark = -(1/(std_dev * np.sqrt(2 * np.pi))) * \
    np.exp(-0.5 * ((x - mean) / std_dev)**2)

plot_1 = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, y_light)
plt.title('Chart 1')
plt.close()
plot_1.savefig("chart_1.png")
``` 

![](chart_1.png)
:::

::: {.g-col-6 .g-col-md-4}
```{python}
#| echo: false
plot_2 = plt.figure()
plt.plot(x, y_dark)
plt.title('Chart 2')
plt.close()
plot_2.savefig("chart_2.png")
```

:::

::: {.g-col-6 .g-col-md-4}
